subprotocols.name: Streams
subprotocols.purpose: Streams provide a way to send and receive data in a QUIC connection, with each stream being a unidirectional or bidirectional channel.

subprotocols.name: Flow Control
subprotocols.purpose: Flow control ensures that a sender does not overwhelm a receiver with data, by limiting the amount of data that can be sent before receiving an acknowledgment.

subprotocols.name: Connection Management
subprotocols.purpose: Connection management includes the establishment, maintenance, and termination of QUIC connections, including handling of connection IDs and state transitions.

subprotocols.name: Connection Migration
subprotocols.purpose: Connection migration allows a QUIC connection to move between different network paths, ensuring continuity of communication even when the network changes.

subprotocols.name: Error Handling
subprotocols.purpose: Error handling defines the mechanisms for detecting and responding to errors in QUIC, including the use of error codes and frames to manage connection failures.
